mapper.insert: insert into s_log_grade( log_level, create_user_id, update_user_id, create_time, update_time, state, iscancel, remark ) values ( #{logLevel}, #{createUserId}, #{updateUserId}, #{createTime}, #{updateTime}, #{state}, #{iscancel}, #{remark} )
mapper.update: update s_log_grade set log_level = #{logGrade.logLevel}, create_user_id = #{logGrade.createUserId}, update_user_id = #{logGrade.updateUserId}, create_time = #{logGrade.createTime}, update_time = #{logGrade.updateTime}, state = #{logGrade.state}, iscancel = #{logGrade.iscancel}, remark = #{logGrade.remark} where id = #{id}
mapper.select: select id, log_level AS logLevel, create_user_id AS createUserId, update_user_id AS updateUserId, create_time AS createTime, update_time AS updateTime, state, iscancel, remark from s_log_grade where id = #{id}

select id, log_level AS logLevel, create_user_id AS createUserId, update_user_id AS updateUserId, create_time AS createTime, update_time AS updateTime, state, iscancel, remark from s_log_grade where 1=1 limit #{page.offset},#{page.pageSize}
